page.title: 07COAL MINING-GALSTON
page.content: The coal mining in Galston made it quite popular.The fathers and sons worked in the coalmines and the women and daughters worked in the lace factories.The mining companies built "Miners Rows"near the pit heads.The Community expanded to approximately 6000 inhabitants in 1911.The demand for coal dwindled and the population dropped.During the later half of the 19thC and up until the General Strike in 1926 coal mining was the main source of employment.The first pits were at Gauchalland ,Burnhouse, Burnhousehill and Courthorn.Before coal was mined peat was burned,this being obtained from Galston Muir.At one time there were 15 collieries in the district employing 1100 men.
